original: chags med byams dang snying rje las byung ba'i //

original: 'di de nyid ni bla med byang chub lam //

original: rab rib can ni mkha' la skra mthong smra //
analyzed: rab rib can ni mkha' la skra mthong smra //

original: rab rib can dang 'gro kun khyad med kyi //
analyzed: rab rib can dang 'gro kun khyad med kyi //
translated: There is no difference between those with cataracts and all beings.

original: skye med gnas med 'gro kun yang dag par //
analyzed: skye med gnas med 'gro kun yang dag par //
translated: All beings are truly seen to be unborn, baseless, and nonexistent,

original: mig 'phrul ji bzhin nges par yongs su snang //

translated: Just like an illusion.🔽Do not be attached to the elaborations of analysis;

analyzed: 'di lta'i ting nge 'dzin bde ba chen por smra //

analyzed: skye dang 'chi ba'i 'jigs pas gar yang gnod pa med //

analyzed: kye lags yid kyi ri dags bde ba'i chu 'dod ba ;
translated: Alas! The deer of the mind, desiring the water of bliss,🔽do not run toward the mirage of objects,

analyzed: / yul gyi smig rgyu la ni ma rgyug dang // yul gyi smig rgyu gang la'ang bde chu med //

original: gang gi ngo bo shes pas gar yang 'gro med pa'i //

original: gang la yid kyi bya rgod rten pa'i shing //
analyzed: gang la yid kyi bya rgod rten pa'i shing //
translated: The tree on which the vulture of the mind depends,

original: de la bde ba'i me tog lo ma skye ba med //
analyzed: de la bde ba'i me tog lo ma skye ba med //

original: nges par yid kyi bya rgod bcings bsad na //

analyzed: gang tshe yid kyi bya rgod bcings las grol bas na //

analyzed: sha thag mang po 'thung zhing za bas bkres pa med //

original: gnyis su mthong ba'i phyogs ni bcom pas khyod //
analyzed: gnyis su mthong ba'i phyogs ni bcom pas khyod //
translated: Since the side of dualistic seeing is destroyed,

original: gang gis gar yang 'bad pa byed pa med //
analyzed: gang gis gar yang 'bad pa byed pa med //

analyzed: stong nyid brtan gyis 'khrul pa spang du med //

translated: In order to teach others the meaning of the ultimate Heruka just as he saw it through the meaning of the entities themselves, the great scholar Shri Dipamkarajñana, when he was invited to the seat of Vajradhara, sang this vajra song at the great Shri Nama in Kyisho Nyetang:
